design_system.description: Design system for Diamond Power Roadmap app. This file contains all design tokens, patterns, and guidelines to recreate this visual style in any iOS app.

colors.description: Color palette using hex values. All colors support dark mode by default.

background.usage: root is primary background, rootAlt is used in gradients for depth

text.usage: primary for headings/important text, secondary for descriptions/metadata, onAccent for text on yellow accent buttons

accent.usage: brandYellow is primary accent for buttons/tab bar/progress, brandBlue for interactive elements like DatePicker, brandRed for borders/destructive actions

semantic.usage: Use SwiftUI's built-in semantic colors (.green, .yellow, .red, .gray, .blue) for status indicators

typography.description: Font system using SF Pro (system font). All fonts use .system() with specified size and weight.

caption.usage: Metadata, timestamps, secondary info, status labels

sectionSubtitle.usage: Card titles, section headers, form field labels

spacing.description: Consistent spacing scale using CGFloat values. Used for padding, gaps, and margins.

usage_patterns.vstack_spacing_in_cards: s (8pt) or xs (4pt) for tight groups

corner_radius.description: Border radius scale for rounded corners

usage_patterns.cards: xl (18pt) - project cards, stage cards, task cards
usage_patterns.nested_cards: m (7pt) - cards within cards or forms

shadows.description: Shadow system for depth and elevation

card.usage: Standard card shadows for content cards

shadows.implementation: .shadow(color: Color(red: R, green: G, blue: B, opacity: O), radius: RADIUS, x: X, y: Y)

card_border.usage: Colored borders on cards matching status/type

input_border.usage: Text fields and text editors in forms

components.description: Common UI component patterns and their specifications

cards.description: Content cards are the primary container pattern

structure.border: 2pt stroke with status color at 0.4 opacity

content_layout.header_pattern: HStack with title on left, status/action on right
content_layout.metadata_pattern: HStack with left-aligned and right-aligned info
content_layout.description_spacing: xs (4pt) top padding before description text

floating_action_button.description: Primary action button, usually at bottom of screen

status_badge.description: Status indicator with colored dot and label

structure.dot: Circle() with 10pt height, filled with status color
structure.label: Font.Theme.caption with Color.Text.secondary

status_tag.description: Pill-shaped status indicator with icon and text

structure.placement: After metadata, before description in cards

structure.label: Font.Theme.sectionSubtitle with Color.Text.secondary, s (8pt) spacing to field

structure.layout: HStack of Capsules with s (8pt) spacing

icons.sizing: Match font size - use .font() modifier with theme font
icons.coloring: Match semantic meaning - status colors, accent colors, or text colors

button_style.primary_cta: Custom capsule button with yellow background

tappable_areas.cards: Entire card is often tappable via NavigationLink

focus_management.dismiss: Tap background to dismiss keyboard using .onTapGesture on contentShape(Rectangle())

animations.note: No custom animation timing observed - rely on SwiftUI defaults

accessibility.dynamic_type: All text uses .font() with system fonts - supports Dynamic Type automatically
accessibility.contrast: High contrast with white text on dark background
accessibility.semantic_colors: System colors for status indicators support accessibility settings

implementation_notes.description: Technical implementation guidelines for recreating this design

file_structure.design_tokens: Create DesignTokens.swift enum with nested Spacing, CornerRadius, Shadow enums
file_structure.color_extensions: Extend Color with nested Background, Text, Accent enums, add hex initializer
file_structure.font_extensions: Extend Font with Theme enum containing static font properties
file_structure.view_extensions: Create custom view modifiers: mainBackground(), cardShadow()

color_implementation.hex_support: Add Color(hex: String) initializer to parse hex colors
color_implementation.nested_enums: Use nested enums for organized color access: Color.Background.root

key_patterns: All cards: VStack with s/xs spacing, m padding, xl cornerRadius, 2pt status-colored stroke
Form fields: Label above field, s spacing, m cornerRadius, brandRed stroke
Status indicators: Small colored circle + caption text
CTAs: Yellow capsule buttons at bottom with xl horizontal padding
Metadata: caption font with secondary text color
Titles: sectionSubtitle font with primary text color
Progress: Yellow-tinted ProgressView between metadata and description

do: Use design tokens for all spacing, corner radius, colors
Apply consistent padding (m for cards, l for screen edges)
Use HStack for left/right aligned content
Apply status colors to borders and status indicators
Use yellow as primary accent for actions and progress
Keep shadows subtle with proper opacity
Use SF Symbols for all icons
Let SwiftUI handle default animations and transitions
dont: Hardcode spacing or color values directly in views
Mix different corner radius sizes on same component
Use bright colors on dark background without proper contrast
Create custom button shapes when Capsule or system styles work
Use custom fonts - stick to SF Pro (system)
Forget stroke overlays on cards - they're part of the style
